endpoints.notes:
Creates a file with some content in it or a folder
    path: Mandatory parameter. Whole path containing the file or folder name to be created
    type: Mandatory parameter. Type of file being created: FILE or DIRECTORY
    content: Only applicable if type is FILE. Content of the file in UTF-8 format. If file format is IMAGE, a base64 content is expected.
    format: File format.

endpoints.description: Update annotations from an annotationSet

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: File id, name or path. Paths must be separated by : instead of /

parameters.name: study
parameters.description: Study [[user@]project:]study where study and project can be either the ID or UUID

parameters.name: annotationSet
parameters.description: AnnotationSet ID to be updated.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Action to be performed: ADD to add new annotations; REPLACE to replace the value of an already existing annotation; SET to set the new list of annotations removing any possible old annotations; REMOVE to remove some annotations; RESET to set some annotations to the default value configured in the corresponding variables of the VariableSet if any.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Json containing the map of annotations when the action is ADD, SET or REPLACE, a json with only the key 'remove' containing the comma separated variables to be removed as a value when the action is REMOVE or a json with only the key 'reset' containing the comma separated variables that will be set to the default value when the action is RESET

endpoints.notes:
The usage of /{file}/download webservice through Swagger is discouraged. Please, don't click the 'Try it out' button here as it may hang this web page. Instead, build the final URL in a different tab.
An special DOWNLOAD permission is needed to download files from OpenCGA.

endpoints.description: Update annotations from an annotationSet

parameters.name: sample
parameters.description: Sample ID

parameters.name: study
parameters.description: Study [[user@]project:]study where study and project can be either the ID or UUID

parameters.name: annotationSet
parameters.description: AnnotationSet ID to be updated.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Action to be performed: ADD to add new annotations; REPLACE to replace the value of an already existing annotation; SET to set the new list of annotations removing any possible old annotations; REMOVE to remove some annotations; RESET to set some annotations to the default value configured in the corresponding variables of the VariableSet if any.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Json containing the map of annotations when the action is ADD, SET or REPLACE, a json with only the key 'remove' containing the comma separated variables to be removed as a value when the action is REMOVE or a json with only the key 'reset' containing the comma separated variables that will be set to the default value when the action is RESET

endpoints.description: Update the set of permissions granted for the member

parameters.name: study
parameters.description: Study [[user@]project:]study where study and project can be either the ID or UUID

parameters.name: members
parameters.description: Comma separated list of user or group ids

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Action to be performed [ADD, SET, REMOVE or RESET].

parameters.name: propagate
parameters.description: Propagate individual permissions to related samples

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: JSON containing the parameters to update the permissions. If propagate flag is set to true, it will propagate the permissions defined to the samples that are associated to the matching individuals

data.name: permissions
data.description: The body web service permissions parameter

data.name: individual
data.description: The body individual IndividualAclUpdateParams web service parameter

data.name: sample
data.description: The body sample IndividualAclUpdateParams web service parameter

endpoints.description: Load annotation sets from a TSV file

parameters.name: study
parameters.description: Study [[user@]project:]study where study and project can be either the ID or UUID

parameters.name: variableSetId
parameters.description: Variable set ID or name

parameters.name: path
parameters.description: Path where the TSV file is located in OpenCGA or where it should be located.

parameters.name: parents
parameters.description: Flag indicating whether to create parent directories if they don't exist (only when TSV file was not previously associated).

parameters.name: annotationSetId
parameters.description: Annotation set id. If not provided, variableSetId will be used.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: JSON containing the 'content' of the TSV file if this has not yet been registered into OpenCGA

data.description: The body content TsvAnnotationParams web service parameter

endpoints.description: Update annotations from an annotationSet

parameters.name: individual
parameters.description: Individual ID, name or UUID

parameters.name: study
parameters.description: Study [[user@]project:]study where study and project can be either the ID or UUID

parameters.name: annotationSet
parameters.description: AnnotationSet ID to be updated.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Action to be performed: ADD to add new annotations; REPLACE to replace the value of an already existing annotation; SET to set the new list of annotations removing any possible old annotations; REMOVE to remove some annotations; RESET to set some annotations to the default value configured in the corresponding variables of the VariableSet if any.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Json containing the map of annotations when the action is ADD, SET or REPLACE, a json with only the key 'remove' containing the comma separated variables to be removed as a value when the action is REMOVE or a json with only the key 'reset' containing the comma separated variables that will be set to the default value when the action is RESET

endpoints.description: Update annotations from an annotationSet

parameters.name: family
parameters.description: Family id

parameters.name: study
parameters.description: Study [[user@]project:]study where study and project can be either the ID or UUID

parameters.name: annotationSet
parameters.description: AnnotationSet ID to be updated.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Action to be performed: ADD to add new annotations; REPLACE to replace the value of an already existing annotation; SET to set the new list of annotations removing any possible old annotations; REMOVE to remove some annotations; RESET to set some annotations to the default value configured in the corresponding variables of the VariableSet if any.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Json containing the map of annotations when the action is ADD, SET or REPLACE, a json with only the key 'remove' containing the comma separated variables to be removed as a value when the action is REMOVE or a json with only the key 'reset' containing the comma separated variables that will be set to the default value when the action is RESET

endpoints.description: Update annotations from an annotationSet

parameters.name: cohort
parameters.description: Cohort ID

parameters.name: study
parameters.description: Study [[user@]project:]study where study and project can be either the ID or UUID

parameters.name: annotationSet
parameters.description: AnnotationSet ID to be updated.

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Action to be performed: ADD to add new annotations; REPLACE to replace the value of an already existing annotation; SET to set the new list of annotations removing any possible old annotations; REMOVE to remove some annotations; RESET to set some annotations to the default value configured in the corresponding variables of the VariableSet if any.

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Json containing the map of annotations when the action is ADD, SET or REPLACE, a json with only the key 'remove' containing the comma separated variables to be removed as a value when the action is REMOVE or a json with only the key 'reset' containing the comma separated variables that will be set to the default value when the action is RESET

parameters.name: action
parameters.description: Action to be performed [ADD, SET, REMOVE or RESET].

parameters.name: body

data.description: The body web service permissions parameter

endpoints.description: Panel distinct method

parameters.name: study
parameters.description: Study [[user@]project:]study where study and project can be either the ID or UUID

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: Comma separated list of panel IDs  up to a maximum of 100

parameters.name: uuid
parameters.description: Comma separated list of panel UUIDs  up to a maximum of 100

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Comma separated list of panel names  up to a maximum of 100

parameters.name: internalStatus
parameters.description: Filter by internal status

parameters.name: disorders
parameters.description: Comma separated list of disorder ids or names

parameters.name: variants
parameters.description: Comma separated list of variant ids

parameters.name: genes
parameters.description: Comma separated list of gene ids

parameters.name: source
parameters.description: Comma separated list of source ids or names.

parameters.name: regions
parameters.description: Comma separated list of regions

parameters.name: categories
parameters.description: Comma separated list of category names

parameters.name: tags
parameters.description: Panel tags

parameters.name: deleted
parameters.description: Boolean to retrieve deleted entries

parameters.name: status
parameters.description: Filter by status

parameters.name: creationDate
parameters.description: Creation date. Format: yyyyMMddHHmmss. Examples: >2018, 2017-2018, <201805

parameters.name: modificationDate
parameters.description: Modification date. Format: yyyyMMddHHmmss. Examples: >2018, 2017-2018, <201805

parameters.name: acl
parameters.description: Filter entries for which a user has the provided permissions. Format: acl={user}:{permissions}. Example: acl=john:WRITE,WRITE_ANNOTATIONS will return all entries for which user john has both WRITE and WRITE_ANNOTATIONS permissions. Only study owners or administrators can query by this field.

parameters.name: release
parameters.description: Release when it was created

parameters.name: snapshot
parameters.description: Snapshot value (Latest version of the entry in the specified release)

parameters.name: field
parameters.description: Comma separated list of fields for which to obtain the distinct values

endpoints.description: Import panels

parameters.name: study
parameters.description: Study [[user@]project:]study where study and project can be either the ID or UUID

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: Job ID. It must be a unique string within the study. An ID will be autogenerated automatically if not provided.

parameters.name: jobDependsOn
parameters.description: Comma separated list of existing job IDs the job will depend on.

parameters.name: jobDescription
parameters.description: Job description

parameters.name: jobTags
parameters.description: Job tags

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Panel parameters

data.name: source
data.description: Comma separated list of sources to import panels from. Current supported sources are 'panelapp' and 'cancer-gene-census'

data.name: id
data.description: Comma separated list of panel IDs to be imported from the defined source.If 'source' is provided and 'id' is empty, it will import all the panels from the source. When 'id' is provided, only one 'source' will be allowed.

endpoints.description: Query the coverage of an alignment file for regions or genes

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: File ID

parameters.name: study
parameters.description: Study [[user@]project:]study where study and project can be either the ID or UUID

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: Comma separated list of regions 'chr:start-end, e.g.: 2,3:63500-65000

parameters.name: gene
parameters.description: Comma separated list of genes, e.g.: BCRA2,TP53

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset to extend the region, gene or exon at up and downstream

parameters.name: onlyExons
parameters.description: Only exons are taking into account when genes are specified

parameters.name: range
parameters.description: Range of coverage values to be reported. Minimum and maximum values are separated by '-', e.g.: 20-40 (for coverage values greater or equal to 20 and less or equal to 40). A single value means to report coverage values less or equal to that value

parameters.name: windowSize
parameters.description: Window size for the region coverage (if a coverage range is provided, window size must be 1)

parameters.name: splitResults
parameters.description: Split results into regions (or gene/exon regions)

parameters.description: Do not apply Log2 to normalise the coverage ratio

parameters.description: Comma separated list of regions 'chr:start-end, e.g.: 2,3:63500-65000

parameters.name: offset
parameters.description: Offset to extend the region, gene or exon at up and downstream

parameters.name: onlyExons

parameters.name: windowSize
parameters.description: Window size for the region coverage (if a coverage range is provided, window size must be 1)

parameters.name: splitResults
parameters.description: Split results into regions (or gene/exon regions)

parameters.name: jobDescription
parameters.description: Job description

parameters.name: jobTags
parameters.description: Job tags

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Alignment quality control (QC) parameters. It computes: stats, flag stats and fastqc metrics. The BAM file ID is mandatory and in order to skip some metrics, use the following keywords (separated by commas): stats, flagstats, fastqc

data.name: bamFile
data.description: ID for the BAM file to process.

data.name: skip
data.description: To skip any alignment QC metrics use the following keywords (separated by commas): stats, flagstats, fastqc

data.name: overwrite
data.description: To overwrite the QC metrics already computed.

data.name: outdir
data.description: Output dir for the job.

endpoints.description: Calculate and fetch aggregation stats

parameters.name: savedFilter
parameters.description: Use a saved filter at User level

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: List of regions, these can be just a single chromosome name or regions in the format chr:start-end, e.g.: 2,3:100000-200000

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: List of types, accepted values are SNV, MNV, INDEL, SV, COPY_NUMBER, COPY_NUMBER_LOSS, COPY_NUMBER_GAIN, INSERTION, DELETION, DUPLICATION, TANDEM_DUPLICATION, BREAKEND, e.g. SNV,INDEL

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project [user@]project where project can be either the ID or the alias

parameters.name: study
parameters.description: Filter variants from the given studies, these can be either the numeric ID or the alias with the format user@project:study

parameters.name: cohort
parameters.description: Select variants with calculated stats for the selected cohorts

parameters.name: cohortStatsRef
parameters.description: Reference Allele Frequency: [{study:}]{cohort}[<|>|<=|>=]{number}. e.g. ALL<=0.4

parameters.name: cohortStatsAlt
parameters.description: Alternate Allele Frequency: [{study:}]{cohort}[<|>|<=|>=]{number}. e.g. ALL<=0.4

parameters.name: cohortStatsMaf
parameters.description: Minor Allele Frequency: [{study:}]{cohort}[<|>|<=|>=]{number}. e.g. ALL<=0.4

parameters.name: cohortStatsMgf
parameters.description: Minor Genotype Frequency: [{study:}]{cohort}[<|>|<=|>=]{number}. e.g. ALL<=0.4

parameters.name: cohortStatsPass
parameters.description: Filter PASS frequency: [{study:}]{cohort}[<|>|<=|>=]{number}. e.g. ALL>0.8

parameters.name: missingAlleles
parameters.description: Number of missing alleles: [{study:}]{cohort}[<|>|<=|>=]{number}

parameters.name: missingGenotypes
parameters.description: Number of missing genotypes: [{study:}]{cohort}[<|>|<=|>=]{number}

parameters.name: score
parameters.description: Filter by variant score: [{study:}]{score}[<|>|<=|>=]{number}

parameters.name: annotationExists
parameters.description: Return only annotated variants

parameters.name: gene
parameters.description: List of genes, most gene IDs are accepted (HGNC, Ensembl gene, ...). This is an alias to 'xref' parameter

parameters.name: ct
parameters.description: List of SO consequence types, e.g. missense_variant,stop_lost or SO:0001583,SO:0001578. Accepts aliases 'loss_of_function' and 'protein_altering'

parameters.name: xref
parameters.description: List of any external reference, these can be genes, proteins or variants. Accepted IDs include HGNC, Ensembl genes, dbSNP, ClinVar, HPO, Cosmic, ...

parameters.name: biotype
parameters.description: List of biotypes, e.g. protein_coding

parameters.name: proteinSubstitution
parameters.description: Protein substitution scores include SIFT and PolyPhen. You can query using the score {protein_score}[<|>|<=|>=]{number} or the description {protein_score}[~=|=]{description} e.g. polyphen>0.1,sift=tolerant

parameters.name: conservation
parameters.description: Filter by conservation score: {conservation_score}[<|>|<=|>=]{number} e.g. phastCons>0.5,phylop<0.1,gerp>0.1

parameters.name: populationFrequencyAlt
parameters.description: Alternate Population Frequency: {study}:{population}[<|>|<=|>=]{number}. e.g. 1000G:ALL<0.01

parameters.name: populationFrequencyRef
parameters.description: Reference Population Frequency: {study}:{population}[<|>|<=|>=]{number}. e.g. 1000G:ALL<0.01

parameters.name: populationFrequencyMaf
parameters.description: Population minor allele frequency: {study}:{population}[<|>|<=|>=]{number}. e.g. 1000G:ALL<0.01

parameters.name: transcriptFlag
parameters.description: List of transcript flags. e.g. canonical, CCDS, basic, LRG, MANE Select, MANE Plus Clinical, EGLH_HaemOnc, TSO500

parameters.name: geneTraitId
parameters.description: List of gene trait association id. e.g. "umls:C0007222" , "OMIM:269600"

parameters.name: go
parameters.description: List of GO (Gene Ontology) terms. e.g. "GO:0002020"

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: List of tissues of interest. e.g. "lung"

parameters.name: proteinKeyword
parameters.description: List of Uniprot protein variant annotation keywords

parameters.name: drug
parameters.description: List of drug names

parameters.name: functionalScore
parameters.description: Functional score: {functional_score}[<|>|<=|>=]{number} e.g. cadd_scaled>5.2 , cadd_raw<=0.3

parameters.name: clinical
parameters.description: Clinical source: clinvar, cosmic

parameters.name: clinicalSignificance
parameters.description: Clinical significance: benign, likely_benign, likely_pathogenic, pathogenic

parameters.name: clinicalConfirmedStatus
parameters.description: Clinical confirmed status

parameters.name: customAnnotation
parameters.description: Custom annotation: {key}[<|>|<=|>=]{number} or {key}[~=|=]{text}

parameters.name: trait
parameters.description: List of traits, based on ClinVar, HPO, COSMIC, i.e.: IDs, histologies, descriptions,...

parameters.name: field

data.description: Output directory

parameters.name: project
parameters.description: Project [user@]project where project can be either the ID or the alias

parameters.name: study
parameters.description: Filter variants from the given studies, these can be either the numeric ID or the alias with the format user@project:study

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: Filter variants from the files specified. This will set includeFile parameter when not provided

parameters.name: sample
parameters.description: Filter variants by sample genotype. This will automatically set 'includeSample' parameter when not provided. This filter accepts multiple 3 forms: 1) List of samples: Samples that contain the main variant. Accepts AND (;) and OR (,) operators.  e.g. HG0097,HG0098 . 2) List of samples with genotypes: {sample}:{gt1},{gt2}. Accepts AND (;) and OR (,) operators.  e.g. HG0097:0/0;HG0098:0/1,1/1 . Unphased genotypes (e.g. 0/1, 1/1) will also include phased genotypes (e.g. 0|1, 1|0, 1|1), but not vice versa. When filtering by multi-allelic genotypes, any secondary allele will match, regardless of its position e.g. 1/2 will match with genotypes 1/2, 1/3, 1/4, .... Genotype aliases accepted: HOM_REF, HOM_ALT, HET, HET_REF, HET_ALT, HET_MISS and MISS  e.g. HG0097:HOM_REF;HG0098:HET_REF,HOM_ALT . 3) Sample with segregation mode: {sample}:{segregation}. Only one sample accepted.Accepted segregation modes: [ autosomalDominant, autosomalRecessive, XLinkedDominant, XLinkedRecessive, YLinked, mitochondrial, deNovo, deNovoStrict, mendelianError, compoundHeterozygous ]. Value is case insensitive. e.g. HG0097:DeNovo Sample must have parents defined and indexed.

parameters.name: includeStudy
parameters.description: List of studies to include in the result. Accepts 'all' and 'none'.

parameters.name: includeFile
parameters.description: List of files to be returned. Accepts 'all' and 'none'. If undefined, automatically includes files used for filtering. If none, no file is included.

parameters.name: includeSample
parameters.description: List of samples to be included in the result. Accepts 'all' and 'none'. If undefined, automatically includes samples used for filtering. If none, no sample is included.

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Fields included in the response, whole JSON path must be provided

parameters.name: exclude
parameters.description: Fields excluded in the response, whole JSON path must be provided

endpoints.description: Run mutational signature analysis for a given sample. Use context index.

parameters.name: study
parameters.description: Filter variants from the given studies, these can be either the numeric ID or the alias with the format user@project:study

parameters.name: sample
parameters.description: Sample name

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: Variant type. Valid values: SNV, SV

parameters.name: ct
parameters.description: List of SO consequence types, e.g. missense_variant,stop_lost or SO:0001583,SO:0001578. Accepts aliases 'loss_of_function' and 'protein_altering'

parameters.name: biotype
parameters.description: List of biotypes, e.g. protein_coding

parameters.name: fileData
parameters.description: Filter by file data (i.e. FILTER, QUAL and INFO columns from VCF file). [{file}:]{key}{op}{value}[,;]* . If no file is specified, will use all files from "file" filter. e.g. AN>200 or file_1.vcf:AN>200;file_2.vcf:AN<10 . Many fields can be combined. e.g. file_1.vcf:AN>200;DB=true;file_2.vcf:AN<10,FILTER=PASS,LowDP

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Specify the FILTER for any of the files. If 'file' filter is provided, will match the file and the filter. e.g.: PASS,LowGQX

parameters.name: qual
parameters.description: Specify the QUAL for any of the files. If 'file' filter is provided, will match the file and the qual. e.g.: >123.4

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: List of regions, these can be just a single chromosome name or regions in the format chr:start-end, e.g.: 2,3:100000-200000

parameters.name: gene
parameters.description: List of genes, most gene IDs are accepted (HGNC, Ensembl gene, ...). This is an alias to 'xref' parameter

parameters.name: panel
parameters.description: Filter by genes from the given disease panel

parameters.name: panelModeOfInheritance
parameters.description: Filter genes from specific panels that match certain mode of inheritance. Accepted values : [ autosomalDominant, autosomalRecessive, XLinkedDominant, XLinkedRecessive, YLinked, mitochondrial, deNovo, mendelianError, compoundHeterozygous ]

parameters.name: panelConfidence
parameters.description: Filter genes from specific panels that match certain confidence. Accepted values : [ high, medium, low, rejected ]

parameters.name: panelFeatureType
parameters.description: Filter elements from specific panels by type. Accepted values : [ gene, region, str, variant ]

parameters.name: panelRoleInCancer
parameters.description: Filter genes from specific panels that match certain role in cancer. Accepted values : [ both, oncogene, tumorSuppressorGene, fusion ]

parameters.name: panelIntersection
parameters.description: Intersect panel genes and regions with given genes and regions from que input query. This will prevent returning variants from regions out of the panel.

parameters.name: msId
parameters.description: Signature ID.

parameters.name: msDescription
parameters.description: Signature description.

endpoints.description: Run mutational signature analysis for a given sample.

parameters.name: study
parameters.description: Study [[user@]project:]study where study and project can be either the ID or UUID

parameters.name: jobId
parameters.description: Job ID. It must be a unique string within the study. An ID will be autogenerated automatically if not provided.

parameters.name: jobDescription
parameters.description: Job description

parameters.name: jobDependsOn
parameters.description: Comma separated list of existing job IDs the job will depend on.

parameters.name: jobTags
parameters.description: Job tags

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Mutational signature analysis parameters to index the genome context for that sample, and to compute both catalogue counts and signature fitting. In order to skip one of them, , use the following keywords: , catalogue, fitting.

data.name: id
data.description: Signature ID.

data.name: description
data.description: Field to store information of the item

data.name: sample
data.description: Sample.

data.name: query
data.description: Signature query in JSON format, e.g: ""{\"sample\":\"NR123456_T\", \"fileData\": \"NR.123456_T_vs_NR.1234567_G.annot.vcf.gz:FILTER=PASS;CLPM<=0;ASMD>=140\"}".

data.name: fitId
data.description: Fiiting signature ID

data.name: fitMethod
data.description: Either Fit or FitMS. If not specified then FitMS

data.name: fitNBoot
data.description: Number of bootstrap to be used.

data.name: fitSigVersion
data.description: Either COSMICv2, COSMICv3.2, RefSigv1 or RefSigv2. If not specified RefSigv2.

data.name: fitOrgan
data.description: When using RefSigv1 or RefSigv2 as SIGVERSION, organ-specific signatures will be used. If SIGVERSION is COSMICv2 or COSMICv3.2, then a selection of signatures found in the given organ will be used. Available organs depend on the selected SIGVERSION. For RefSigv1 or RefSigv2: Biliary, Bladder, Bone_SoftTissue, Breast, Cervix (v1 only), CNS, Colorectal, Esophagus, Head_neck, Kidney, Liver, Lung, Lymphoid, NET (v2 only), Oral_Oropharyngeal (v2 only), Ovary, Pancreas, Prostate, Skin, Stomach, Uterus.

data.name: fitThresholdPerc
data.description: Threshold in percentage of total mutations in a sample, only exposures larger than THRPERC are considered. If not specified 5.

data.name: fitThresholdPval
data.description: P-value to determine the empirical probability that the exposure is lower than the threshold. If not specified then 0.05.

data.name: fitMaxRareSigs
data.description: Maximum number of rare signatures that are allowed to be present in each sample. If not specified 1.

data.name: fitSignaturesFile
data.description: The file name containing mutational signatures. Each signature is in a column, with signature names as column hearders and channel names as row names in the first column with no header. Each column must sum to 1. Use only to provide your own signatures. When fitmethod=FitMS, these signatures are considered common signatures.

data.name: fitRareSignaturesFile
data.description: The file name containing mutational signatures. Each signature is in a column, with signature names as column hearders and channel names as row names in the first column with no header. Each column must sum to 1. Use only to provide your own signatures. When fitmethod=FitMS, these signatures are considered rare signatures.

data.name: skip
data.description: To skip to compute catalogue counts or the signature fitting. Use  the following keywords: catalogue, fitting.

data.name: outdir
data.description: Output dir for the job.

parameters.description: Sampling size to get the approximate count. Larger values increase accuracy but also increase execution time

parameters.name: genotype
parameters.description: Samples with a specific genotype: {samp_1}:{gt_1}(,{gt_n})*(;{samp_n}:{gt_1}(,{gt_n})*)* e.g. HG0097:0/0;HG0098:0/1,1/1. Unphased genotypes (e.g. 0/1, 1/1) will also include phased genotypes (e.g. 0|1, 1|0, 1|1), but not vice versa. When filtering by multi-allelic genotypes, any secondary allele will match, regardless of its position e.g. 1/2 will match with genotypes 1/2, 1/3, 1/4, .... This will automatically set 'includeSample' parameter when not provided

parameters.name: sampleData
parameters.description: Filter by any SampleData field from samples. [{sample}:]{key}{op}{value}[,;]* . If no sample is specified, will use all samples from "sample" or "genotype" filter. e.g. DP>200 or HG0097:DP>200,HG0098:DP<10 . Many FORMAT fields can be combined. e.g. HG0097:DP>200;GT=1/1,0/1,HG0098:DP<10

parameters.name: sampleAnnotation
parameters.description: Selects some samples using metadata information from Catalog. e.g. age>20;phenotype=hpo:123,hpo:456;name=smith

parameters.name: sampleMetadata
parameters.description: Return the samples metadata group by study. Sample names will appear in the same order as their corresponding genotypes.

parameters.name: unknownGenotype
parameters.description: Returned genotype for unknown genotypes. Common values: [0/0, 0|0, ./.]

parameters.name: sampleLimit
parameters.description: Limit the number of samples to be included in the result

parameters.name: sampleSkip
parameters.description: Skip some samples from the result. Useful for sample pagination.

parameters.name: cohort
parameters.description: Select variants with calculated stats for the selected cohorts

parameters.name: cohortStatsRef
parameters.description: Reference Allele Frequency: [{study:}]{cohort}[<|>|<=|>=]{number}. e.g. ALL<=0.4

parameters.name: cohortStatsAlt
parameters.description: Alternate Allele Frequency: [{study:}]{cohort}[<|>|<=|>=]{number}. e.g. ALL<=0.4

parameters.name: cohortStatsMaf
parameters.description: Minor Allele Frequency: [{study:}]{cohort}[<|>|<=|>=]{number}. e.g. ALL<=0.4

parameters.name: cohortStatsMgf
parameters.description: Minor Genotype Frequency: [{study:}]{cohort}[<|>|<=|>=]{number}. e.g. ALL<=0.4

parameters.name: cohortStatsPass
parameters.description: Filter PASS frequency: [{study:}]{cohort}[<|>|<=|>=]{number}. e.g. ALL>0.8

parameters.name: missingAlleles
parameters.description: Number of missing alleles: [{study:}]{cohort}[<|>|<=|>=]{number}

parameters.name: missingGenotypes
parameters.description: Number of missing genotypes: [{study:}]{cohort}[<|>|<=|>=]{number}

parameters.name: score
parameters.description: Filter by variant score: [{study:}]{score}[<|>|<=|>=]{number}

parameters.name: family
parameters.description: Filter variants where any of the samples from the given family contains the variant (HET or HOM_ALT)

parameters.name: familyDisorder
parameters.description: Specify the disorder to use for the family segregation

parameters.name: familySegregation
parameters.description: Filter by segregation mode from a given family. Accepted values: [ autosomalDominant, autosomalRecessive, XLinkedDominant, XLinkedRecessive, YLinked, mitochondrial, deNovo, deNovoStrict, mendelianError, compoundHeterozygous ]

parameters.name: familyMembers
parameters.description: Sub set of the members of a given family

parameters.name: familyProband
parameters.description: Specify the proband child to use for the family segregation

parameters.name: includeStudy
parameters.description: List of studies to include in the result. Accepts 'all' and 'none'.

parameters.name: includeFile
parameters.description: List of files to be returned. Accepts 'all' and 'none'. If undefined, automatically includes files used for filtering. If none, no file is included.

parameters.name: includeSample
parameters.description: List of samples to be included in the result. Accepts 'all' and 'none'. If undefined, automatically includes samples used for filtering. If none, no sample is included.

parameters.name: includeSampleData
parameters.description: List of Sample Data keys (i.e. FORMAT column from VCF file) from Sample Data to include in the output. e.g: DP,AD. Accepts 'all' and 'none'.

parameters.name: includeGenotype
parameters.description: Include genotypes, apart of other formats defined with includeFormat

parameters.name: includeSampleId
parameters.description: Include sampleId on each result

parameters.name: annotationExists
parameters.description: Return only annotated variants

parameters.name: gene
parameters.description: List of genes, most gene IDs are accepted (HGNC, Ensembl gene, ...). This is an alias to 'xref' parameter

parameters.name: ct
parameters.description: List of SO consequence types, e.g. missense_variant,stop_lost or SO:0001583,SO:0001578. Accepts aliases 'loss_of_function' and 'protein_altering'

parameters.name: xref
parameters.description: List of any external reference, these can be genes, proteins or variants. Accepted IDs include HGNC, Ensembl genes, dbSNP, ClinVar, HPO, Cosmic, ...

parameters.name: biotype
parameters.description: List of biotypes, e.g. protein_coding

parameters.name: proteinSubstitution
parameters.description: Protein substitution scores include SIFT and PolyPhen. You can query using the score {protein_score}[<|>|<=|>=]{number} or the description {protein_score}[~=|=]{description} e.g. polyphen>0.1,sift=tolerant

parameters.name: conservation
parameters.description: Filter by conservation score: {conservation_score}[<|>|<=|>=]{number} e.g. phastCons>0.5,phylop<0.1,gerp>0.1

parameters.name: populationFrequencyAlt
parameters.description: Alternate Population Frequency: {study}:{population}[<|>|<=|>=]{number}. e.g. 1000G:ALL<0.01

parameters.name: populationFrequencyRef
parameters.description: Reference Population Frequency: {study}:{population}[<|>|<=|>=]{number}. e.g. 1000G:ALL<0.01

parameters.name: populationFrequencyMaf
parameters.description: Population minor allele frequency: {study}:{population}[<|>|<=|>=]{number}. e.g. 1000G:ALL<0.01

parameters.name: transcriptFlag
parameters.description: List of transcript flags. e.g. canonical, CCDS, basic, LRG, MANE Select, MANE Plus Clinical, EGLH_HaemOnc, TSO500

parameters.name: geneTraitId
parameters.description: List of gene trait association id. e.g. "umls:C0007222" , "OMIM:269600"

parameters.name: go
parameters.description: List of GO (Gene Ontology) terms. e.g. "GO:0002020"

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: List of tissues of interest. e.g. "lung"

parameters.name: proteinKeyword
parameters.description: List of Uniprot protein variant annotation keywords

parameters.name: drug
parameters.description: List of drug names

parameters.name: functionalScore
parameters.description: Functional score: {functional_score}[<|>|<=|>=]{number} e.g. cadd_scaled>5.2 , cadd_raw<=0.3

parameters.name: clinical
parameters.description: Clinical source: clinvar, cosmic

parameters.name: clinicalSignificance
parameters.description: Clinical significance: benign, likely_benign, likely_pathogenic, pathogenic

parameters.name: clinicalConfirmedStatus
parameters.description: Clinical confirmed status

parameters.name: customAnnotation
parameters.description: Custom annotation: {key}[<|>|<=|>=]{number} or {key}[~=|=]{text}

parameters.description: Filter genes from specific panels that match certain mode of inheritance. Accepted values : [ autosomalDominant, autosomalRecessive, XLinkedDominant, XLinkedRecessive, YLinked, mitochondrial, deNovo, mendelianError, compoundHeterozygous ]

parameters.name: panelConfidence
parameters.description: Filter genes from specific panels that match certain confidence. Accepted values : [ high, medium, low, rejected ]

parameters.name: panelRoleInCancer
parameters.description: Filter genes from specific panels that match certain role in cancer. Accepted values : [ both, oncogene, tumorSuppressorGene, fusion ]

parameters.name: panelFeatureType
parameters.description: Filter elements from specific panels by type. Accepted values : [ gene, region, str, variant ]

data.name: msId
data.description: Signature ID.

data.name: msDescription
data.description: Signature description.

data.name: msQuery
data.description: Signature query in JSON format, e.g: ""{\"sample\":\"NR123456_T\", \"fileData\": \"NR.123456_T_vs_NR.1234567_G.annot.vcf.gz:FILTER=PASS;CLPM<=0;ASMD>=140\"}".

data.name: msFitId
data.description: Either Fit or FitMS. If not specified then FitMS

data.name: msFitMethod
data.description: Either Fit or FitMS. If not specified then FitMS

data.name: msFitNBoot
data.description: Number of bootstrap to be used.

data.name: msFitSigVersion
data.description: Either COSMICv2, COSMICv3.2, RefSigv1 or RefSigv2. If not specified RefSigv2.

data.name: msFitOrgan
data.description: When using RefSigv1 or RefSigv2 as SIGVERSION, organ-specific signatures will be used. If SIGVERSION is COSMICv2 or COSMICv3.2, then a selection of signatures found in the given organ will be used. Available organs depend on the selected SIGVERSION. For RefSigv1 or RefSigv2: Biliary, Bladder, Bone_SoftTissue, Breast, Cervix (v1 only), CNS, Colorectal, Esophagus, Head_neck, Kidney, Liver, Lung, Lymphoid, NET (v2 only), Oral_Oropharyngeal (v2 only), Ovary, Pancreas, Prostate, Skin, Stomach, Uterus.

data.name: msFitThresholdPerc
data.description: Threshold in percentage of total mutations in a sample, only exposures larger than THRPERC are considered. If not specified 5.

data.name: msFitThresholdPval
data.description: P-value to determine the empirical probability that the exposure is lower than the threshold. If not specified then 0.05.

data.name: msFitMaxRareSigs
data.description: Maximum number of rare signatures that are allowed to be present in each sample. If not specified 1.

data.name: msFitSignaturesFile
data.description: The file name containing mutational signatures. Each signature is in a column, with signature names as column hearders and channel names as row names in the first column with no header. Each column must sum to 1. Use only to provide your own signatures. When fitmethod=FitMS, these signatures are considered common signatures.

data.name: msFitRareSignaturesFile
data.description: The file name containing mutational signatures. Each signature is in a column, with signature names as column hearders and channel names as row names in the first column with no header. Each column must sum to 1. Use only to provide your own signatures. When fitmethod=FitMS, these signatures are considered rare signatures.

data.name: skip
data.description: Quality control metrics to skip. Valid values are: variant-stats, signature, signature-catalogue, signature-fitting, genome-plot

data.description: Output dir for the job.

endpoints.description: Obtain sample variant stats from a sample.

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: List of regions, these can be just a single chromosome name or regions in the format chr:start-end, e.g.: 2,3:100000-200000

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: List of types, accepted values are SNV, MNV, INDEL, SV, COPY_NUMBER, COPY_NUMBER_LOSS, COPY_NUMBER_GAIN, INSERTION, DELETION, DUPLICATION, TANDEM_DUPLICATION, BREAKEND, e.g. SNV,INDEL

parameters.name: study
parameters.description: Filter variants from the given studies, these can be either the numeric ID or the alias with the format user@project:study

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: Filter variants from the files specified. This will set includeFile parameter when not provided

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Specify the FILTER for any of the files. If 'file' filter is provided, will match the file and the filter. e.g.: PASS,LowGQX

parameters.name: sampleData
parameters.description: Filter by any SampleData field from samples. [{sample}:]{key}{op}{value}[,;]* . If no sample is specified, will use all samples from "sample" or "genotype" filter. e.g. DP>200 or HG0097:DP>200,HG0098:DP<10 . Many FORMAT fields can be combined. e.g. HG0097:DP>200;GT=1/1,0/1,HG0098:DP<10

parameters.name: ct
parameters.description: List of SO consequence types, e.g. missense_variant,stop_lost or SO:0001583,SO:0001578. Accepts aliases 'loss_of_function' and 'protein_altering'

parameters.name: biotype
parameters.description: List of biotypes, e.g. protein_coding

parameters.name: transcriptFlag
parameters.description: List of transcript flags. e.g. canonical, CCDS, basic, LRG, MANE Select, MANE Plus Clinical, EGLH_HaemOnc, TSO500

parameters.name: populationFrequencyAlt
parameters.description: Alternate Population Frequency: {study}:{population}[<|>|<=|>=]{number}. e.g. 1000G:ALL<0.01

parameters.description: Clinical source: clinvar, cosmic

parameters.description: Study [[user@]project:]study where study and project can be either the ID or UUID

parameters.name: filterTranscript
parameters.description: Do filter transcripts when obtaining transcript counts

endpoints.description: Fetch clinical variants

parameters.name: include
parameters.description: Fields included in the response, whole JSON path must be provided

parameters.name: exclude
parameters.description: Fields excluded in the response, whole JSON path must be provided

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Number of results to be returned

parameters.name: skip
parameters.description: Number of results to skip

parameters.name: count
parameters.description: Get the total number of results matching the query. Deactivated by default.

parameters.name: approximateCount
parameters.description: Get an approximate count, instead of an exact total count. Reduces execution time

parameters.name: approximateCountSamplingSize
parameters.description: Sampling size to get the approximate count. Larger values increase accuracy but also increase execution time

parameters.name: savedFilter
parameters.description: Use a saved filter at User level

parameters.name: includeInterpretation
parameters.description: Interpretation ID to include the fields related to this interpretation

parameters.name: id
parameters.description: List of IDs, these can be rs IDs (dbSNP) or variants in the format chrom:start:ref:alt, e.g. rs116600158,19:7177679:C:T

parameters.name: region
parameters.description: List of regions, these can be just a single chromosome name or regions in the format chr:start-end, e.g.: 2,3:100000-200000

parameters.name: type
parameters.description: List of types, accepted values are SNV, MNV, INDEL, SV, COPY_NUMBER, COPY_NUMBER_LOSS, COPY_NUMBER_GAIN, INSERTION, DELETION, DUPLICATION, TANDEM_DUPLICATION, BREAKEND, e.g. SNV,INDEL

parameters.name: study
parameters.description: Filter variants from the given studies, these can be either the numeric ID or the alias with the format user@project:study

parameters.name: file
parameters.description: Filter variants from the files specified. This will set includeFile parameter when not provided

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Specify the FILTER for any of the files. If 'file' filter is provided, will match the file and the filter. e.g.: PASS,LowGQX

parameters.name: qual
parameters.description: Specify the QUAL for any of the files. If 'file' filter is provided, will match the file and the qual. e.g.: >123.4

parameters.name: fileData
parameters.description: Filter by file data (i.e. FILTER, QUAL and INFO columns from VCF file). [{file}:]{key}{op}{value}[,;]* . If no file is specified, will use all files from "file" filter. e.g. AN>200 or file_1.vcf:AN>200;file_2.vcf:AN<10 . Many fields can be combined. e.g. file_1.vcf:AN>200;DB=true;file_2.vcf:AN<10,FILTER=PASS,LowDP

parameters.name: sample
parameters.description: Filter variants by sample genotype. This will automatically set 'includeSample' parameter when not provided. This filter accepts multiple 3 forms: 1) List of samples: Samples that contain the main variant. Accepts AND (;) and OR (,) operators.  e.g. HG0097,HG0098 . 2) List of samples with genotypes: {sample}:{gt1},{gt2}. Accepts AND (;) and OR (,) operators.  e.g. HG0097:0/0;HG0098:0/1,1/1 . Unphased genotypes (e.g. 0/1, 1/1) will also include phased genotypes (e.g. 0|1, 1|0, 1|1), but not vice versa. When filtering by multi-allelic genotypes, any secondary allele will match, regardless of its position e.g. 1/2 will match with genotypes 1/2, 1/3, 1/4, .... Genotype aliases accepted: HOM_REF, HOM_ALT, HET, HET_REF, HET_ALT, HET_MISS and MISS  e.g. HG0097:HOM_REF;HG0098:HET_REF,HOM_ALT . 3) Sample with segregation mode: {sample}:{segregation}. Only one sample accepted.Accepted segregation modes: [ autosomalDominant, autosomalRecessive, XLinkedDominant, XLinkedRecessive, YLinked, mitochondrial, deNovo, deNovoStrict, mendelianError, compoundHeterozygous ]. Value is case insensitive. e.g. HG0097:DeNovo Sample must have parents defined and indexed.

parameters.name: sampleData
parameters.description: Filter by any SampleData field from samples. [{sample}:]{key}{op}{value}[,;]* . If no sample is specified, will use all samples from "sample" or "genotype" filter. e.g. DP>200 or HG0097:DP>200,HG0098:DP<10 . Many FORMAT fields can be combined. e.g. HG0097:DP>200;GT=1/1,0/1,HG0098:DP<10

parameters.name: sampleAnnotation
parameters.description: Selects some samples using metadata information from Catalog. e.g. age>20;phenotype=hpo:123,hpo:456;name=smith

parameters.name: cohort
parameters.description: Select variants with calculated stats for the selected cohorts

parameters.name: cohortStatsRef
parameters.description: Reference Allele Frequency: [{study:}]{cohort}[<|>|<=|>=]{number}. e.g. ALL<=0.4

parameters.name: cohortStatsAlt
parameters.description: Alternate Allele Frequency: [{study:}]{cohort}[<|>|<=|>=]{number}. e.g. ALL<=0.4

parameters.name: cohortStatsMaf
parameters.description: Minor Allele Frequency: [{study:}]{cohort}[<|>|<=|>=]{number}. e.g. ALL<=0.4

parameters.name: cohortStatsMgf
parameters.description: Minor Genotype Frequency: [{study:}]{cohort}[<|>|<=|>=]{number}. e.g. ALL<=0.4

parameters.name: cohortStatsPass
parameters.description: Filter PASS frequency: [{study:}]{cohort}[<|>|<=|>=]{number}. e.g. ALL>0.8

parameters.name: missingAlleles
parameters.description: Number of missing alleles: [{study:}]{cohort}[<|>|<=|>=]{number}

parameters.name: missingGenotypes
parameters.description: Number of missing genotypes: [{study:}]{cohort}[<|>|<=|>=]{number}

parameters.name: score
parameters.description: Filter by variant score: [{study:}]{score}[<|>|<=|>=]{number}

parameters.name: family
parameters.description: Filter variants where any of the samples from the given family contains the variant (HET or HOM_ALT)

parameters.name: familyDisorder
parameters.description: Specify the disorder to use for the family segregation

parameters.name: familySegregation
parameters.description: Filter by segregation mode from a given family. Accepted values: [ autosomalDominant, autosomalRecessive, XLinkedDominant, XLinkedRecessive, YLinked, mitochondrial, deNovo, deNovoStrict, mendelianError, compoundHeterozygous ]

parameters.name: familyMembers
parameters.description: Sub set of the members of a given family

parameters.name: familyProband
parameters.description: Specify the proband child to use for the family segregation

parameters.name: gene
parameters.description: List of genes, most gene IDs are accepted (HGNC, Ensembl gene, ...). This is an alias to 'xref' parameter

parameters.name: ct
parameters.description: List of SO consequence types, e.g. missense_variant,stop_lost or SO:0001583,SO:0001578. Accepts aliases 'loss_of_function' and 'protein_altering'

parameters.name: xref
parameters.description: List of any external reference, these can be genes, proteins or variants. Accepted IDs include HGNC, Ensembl genes, dbSNP, ClinVar, HPO, Cosmic, ...

parameters.name: biotype
parameters.description: List of biotypes, e.g. protein_coding

parameters.name: proteinSubstitution
parameters.description: Protein substitution scores include SIFT and PolyPhen. You can query using the score {protein_score}[<|>|<=|>=]{number} or the description {protein_score}[~=|=]{description} e.g. polyphen>0.1,sift=tolerant

parameters.name: conservation
parameters.description: Filter by conservation score: {conservation_score}[<|>|<=|>=]{number} e.g. phastCons>0.5,phylop<0.1,gerp>0.1

parameters.name: populationFrequencyAlt
parameters.description: Alternate Population Frequency: {study}:{population}[<|>|<=|>=]{number}. e.g. 1000G:ALL<0.01

parameters.name: populationFrequencyRef
parameters.description: Reference Population Frequency: {study}:{population}[<|>|<=|>=]{number}. e.g. 1000G:ALL<0.01

parameters.name: populationFrequencyMaf
parameters.description: Population minor allele frequency: {study}:{population}[<|>|<=|>=]{number}. e.g. 1000G:ALL<0.01

parameters.name: transcriptFlag
parameters.description: List of transcript flags. e.g. canonical, CCDS, basic, LRG, MANE Select, MANE Plus Clinical, EGLH_HaemOnc, TSO500

parameters.name: geneTraitId
parameters.description: List of gene trait association id. e.g. "umls:C0007222" , "OMIM:269600"

parameters.name: go
parameters.description: List of GO (Gene Ontology) terms. e.g. "GO:0002020"

parameters.name: expression
parameters.description: List of tissues of interest. e.g. "lung"

parameters.name: proteinKeyword
parameters.description: List of Uniprot protein variant annotation keywords

parameters.name: drug
parameters.description: List of drug names

parameters.name: functionalScore
parameters.description: Functional score: {functional_score}[<|>|<=|>=]{number} e.g. cadd_scaled>5.2 , cadd_raw<=0.3

parameters.name: clinical
parameters.description: Clinical source: clinvar, cosmic

parameters.name: clinicalSignificance
parameters.description: Clinical significance: benign, likely_benign, likely_pathogenic, pathogenic

parameters.name: clinicalConfirmedStatus
parameters.description: Clinical confirmed status

parameters.name: customAnnotation
parameters.description: Custom annotation: {key}[<|>|<=|>=]{number} or {key}[~=|=]{text}

parameters.name: panel
parameters.description: Filter by genes from the given disease panel

parameters.name: panelModeOfInheritance
parameters.description: Filter genes from specific panels that match certain mode of inheritance. Accepted values : [ autosomalDominant, autosomalRecessive, XLinkedDominant, XLinkedRecessive, YLinked, mitochondrial, deNovo, mendelianError, compoundHeterozygous ]

parameters.name: panelConfidence
parameters.description: Filter genes from specific panels that match certain confidence. Accepted values : [ high, medium, low, rejected ]

parameters.name: panelRoleInCancer
parameters.description: Filter genes from specific panels that match certain role in cancer. Accepted values : [ both, oncogene, tumorSuppressorGene, fusion ]

parameters.name: panelFeatureType
parameters.description: Filter elements from specific panels by type. Accepted values : [ gene, region, str, variant ]

parameters.name: panelIntersection
parameters.description: Intersect panel genes and regions with given genes and regions from que input query. This will prevent returning variants from regions out of the panel.

parameters.name: trait
parameters.description: List of traits, based on ClinVar, HPO, COSMIC, i.e.: IDs, histologies, descriptions,...

endpoints.description: Returns the acl of the clinical analyses. If member is provided, it will only return the acl for the member.

parameters.name: clinicalAnalyses

parameters.name: body
parameters.description: Variant score index params. scoreName: Unique name of the score within the study. cohort1: Cohort used to compute the score. Use the cohort 'ALL' if all samples from the study where used to compute the score. cohort2: Second cohort used to compute the score, typically to compare against the first cohort. If only one cohort was used to compute the score, leave empty. inputColumns: Indicate which columns to load from the input file. Provide the column position (starting in 0) for the column with the score with 'SCORE=n'. Optionally, the PValue column with 'PVALUE=n'. The, to indicate the variant associated with the score, provide either the columns ['CHROM', 'POS', 'REF', 'ALT'], or the column 'VAR' containing a variant representation with format 'chr:start:ref:alt'. e.g. 'CHROM=0,POS=1,REF=3,ALT=4,SCORE=5,PVALUE=6' or 'VAR=0,SCORE=1,PVALUE=2'. resume: Resume a previously failed indexation

parameters.name: referenceName
parameters.description: Reference sequence name (Example: 'chr1', '1' or 'chrX'

parameters.name: end
parameters.description: The end position of the range on the reference, 0-based, exclusive.

endpoints.description: Beacon webservice

parameters.name: chrom
parameters.description: Chromosome ID. Accepted values: 1-22, X, Y, MT. Note: For compatibility with conventions set by some of the existing beacons, an arbitrary prefix is accepted as well (e.g. chr1 is equivalent to chrom1 and 1).

parameters.name: pos
parameters.description: Coordinate within a chromosome. Position is a number and is 0-based.

parameters.name: allele
parameters.description: Any string of nucleotides A,C,T,G or D, I for deletion and insertion, respectively. Note: For compatibility with conventions set by some of the existing beacons, DEL and INS identifiers are also accepted.

parameters.name: ref
parameters.description: Genome ID. If not specified, all the genomes supported by the given beacons are queried. Note: For compatibility with conventions set by some of the existing beacons, both GRC or HG notation are accepted, case insensitive.

parameters.name: beacon
parameters.description: Beacon IDs. If specified, only beacons with the given IDs are queried. Responses from all the supported beacons are obtained otherwise. Format: [id1,id2].

parameters.description: Entity to be grouped by.
parameters.allowedValues: AUDIT USER PROJECT STUDY FILE SAMPLE JOB INDIVIDUAL COHORT DISEASE_PANEL FAMILY CLINICAL_ANALYSIS INTERPRETATION VARIANT ALIGNMENT CLINICAL EXPRESSION RGA FUNCTIONAL

endpoints.notes:
id contain a list of resource ids (users or applications) or a single group id to be imported and resourceType contains the type of resource present in the 'id' field (USER, GROUP or APPLICATION).
Optionally, study and studyGroup can be passed. If so, a group with name studyGroup will be created in the study study containing the list of users imported.
authenticationOriginId will correspond to the authentication origin id defined in the main Catalog configuration.
type will be one of 'guest' or 'full'. If not provided, it will be considered 'guest' by default.

endpoints.notes:
Mandatory fields: authOriginId, study
  • authOriginId: Authentication origin id defined in the main Catalog configuration.
  • study: Study [[user@]project:]study where the list of users will be associated to.
  • from: Group defined in the authenticated origin to be synchronised.
  • to: Group in a study that will be synchronised.
  • syncAll: Flag indicating whether to synchronise all the groups present in the study with their corresponding authenticated groups automatically. --from and --to parameters will not be needed when the flagis active..
  • type: User account type of the users to be imported (guest or full).
  • force: Boolean to force the synchronisation with already existing Catalog groups that are not yet synchronised with any other group.
